content: crochetscot- the cowl with no name the cowl with no name crochetscot- the cowl with no name notes this crochet pattern is written in uk terms and is suitable for confident beginners upwards it can be made with 100g of dk yarn and produces a lovely wearable item in a short time i hope you will enjoy making yours abbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half treble_crochet st/sts number of stitches round- round blo back loop only fphtr - front post half treble bphtr - back post half treble repeat- repeat special stitches puff - *insert hook yarn over pull through yarn over repeat 2 more times 6 loops on the hook yarn over pull through all loops front post half treble -yarn over insert your hook from the front to the back at the right of the stitch and bring your hook out at the left of the same stitch then complete the half treble_crochet stitch as normal yarn over and pull through a loop 3 loops on hook yarn over and pull the yarn through all three loops on your hook back post half treble - yarn over insert your hook from the back to the front at the right of the stitch and bring your hook out at the left of the same stitch then complete your half treble_crochet stitch as normal yarn over and pull through a loop 3 loops on hook yarn over and pull the yarn through all three loops on your hook blo means to work in the back loop s only insert your hook under only the back loop which is the loop that is furthest away from you and complete your double_crochet as normal tools 3 5mm and 4mm crochet hooks or the hook size you prefer for dk yarn scissors and yarn needle stitch marker crochetscot- the cowl with no name pattern with dk yarn and a 3 5mm hook make a foundation chain of 111 slip_stitch to join taking care not to twist the chain alternatively you can start with 110 foundation half_double_crochet stitches measure this around your neck and increase or decrease size as needed in multiples of 2 stitches round 1 ch2 does not count as a st half_double_crochet in each chain around slip_stitch to top of beg ch2 110 half_double_crochet round 2 ch2 does not count as a st fphtr around next st bphtr around the next st repeat around slip_stitch to top of beg ch2 rnds 3-4 repeat round 2 rib ends and pattern starts change to 4mm hook you will now work in a spiral without slip stitching at the end of each round to achieve a smooth finish i find it useful to pull a piece of scrap contrast yarn through the final stitch of the round as a marker or use a stitch marker ch1 here before starting the pattern rounds after this you will not ch1 between rounds unless instructed to round 5 double_crochet blo in every st round
